Text: Swaption Vols Cc We are ready to start using Swaption Volatility Curves in our calcs I have identified the following regions and terms that need swaption volatilities posted and the values I have currently entered into curve manager These values were based on the latest deals or my best guess as not all the volatilities are consistent across similar deals Cinergy Cal Entergy Cal Ercot South Cal Nepool Cal Nepool Cal West Hub Cal West Hub Cal NY East zone G Cal position in LTNEMGMT book Options Desk for today only besides final posting swaption vols for today please also final post yesterday Please call if you have any questions Michael Mattox x

Swaption Vols Cc We are ready to start using Swaption Volatility Curves in our calcs I have identified the following regions and terms that need swaption volatilities posted and the values I have currently entered into curve manager These values were based on the latest deals or my best guess as not all the volatilities are consistent across similar deals Cinergy Cal Entergy Cal Ercot South Cal Nepool Cal Nepool Cal West Hub Cal West Hub Cal NY East zone G Cal position in LTNEMGMT book Options Desk for today only besides final posting swaption vols for today please also final post yesterday Please call if you have any questions Michael Mattox x

RE Option SensitivityJust the option traders Harry Arora Rob Stalford Steve Wang and Jaime Gualy Michael Mattox x Original Message From White Stacey W Sent Friday October AM To Mattox Michael Subject RE Option Sensitivity Michael Can you remind me who all gets these reports Stacey Original Message From Mattox Michael Sent Friday October PM To White Stacey W Subject Option Sensitivity Stacey Let me know if this is what you are looking for Approximately every one to two weeks or as requested by the options traders an option sensitivity report is run using PortCalc Three parameters are tested Price increments from to monthly Volatility increments from to and Time increments up to days The data is imported from PortCalc into an Excel pivot table The pivot table is then used to show how the various Greeks delta gamma theta and Vega change for each traders book generally with a month look ahead The data can also be sorted by and grouped by other criteria if requested such as by region and delivery date Michael Mattox x

TAGGERMS request formNot sure which request form everyone is using to set up new gas books I was using the one our RISKMGMTAdminRequests Templates directory Apparently that one is a big dated Jennifer Velasco emailed me a new request form I placed a copy in that directory file name is newBLANKBOOKREQUESTxls Michael Mattox x

New Gas Book Request using the new and improved request form Cc New gas book request attached using the NEW request form per Jennifer Velasco request Please let me know if you have any questions Thanks Michael Mattox x
New Gas Book Request Cc New gas book request attached Please let me know if you have any questions Thanks Michael Mattox x

RE POWERSSRCPRC book Cc On the book with uploaded with MTM delta position and gross position set to zero The book was just made inactive on the website Michael Mattox x Original Message From Hernandez Nancy Sent Friday October PM To Mattox Michael Cc White Stacey W Evans Casey Subject RE POWERSSRCPRC book You can inactive the book on the activeinactive website Do you also need the books counterparty ID inactivated If yes please reply and provide the CPID that needs to be suspended Please also ensue that the book has been uploaded with zeros values to ensure compliance with Credit and cash flow requirments Regards Nancy Original Message From Mattox Michael Sent Friday October PM To Hernandez Nancy Cc White Stacey W Evans Casey Subject POWERSSRCPRC book Nancy The following book POWERSSRCPRC should be made inactive The book was for a compound option that was being calculated on a spreadsheet The option was not exercised and its value was taken to yesterday Thank you Michael Mattox x

Option SensitivityStacey Let me know if this is what you are looking for Approximately every one to two weeks or as requested by the options traders an option sensitivity report is run using PortCalc Three parameters are tested Price increments from to monthly Volatility increments from to and Time increments up to days The data is imported from PortCalc into an Excel pivot table The pivot table is then used to show how the various Greeks delta gamma theta and Vega change for each traders book generally with a month look ahead The data can also be sorted by and grouped by other criteria if requested such as by region and delivery date Michael Mattox x
